intro: Rivea bracteata, commonly known as the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its climbing habit and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing plants like morning glory. Rivea bracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
